backend/main.mo: Defines the main actor and all core game types plus state maps for profiles, combat, clans, events, and dungeons.
backend/migration.mo: Provides data types matching old and new actor structures and logic for migrating stored state between versions.
feature_evidence.json: Lists feature evidence entries mapping features to affected frontend files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Contains prewritten summaries for multiple frontend source files to help with build planning and tracking.
frontend/index.css: Defines global Tailwind CSS variables and dark theme color tokens for the frontend.
frontend/index.html: Basic HTML bootstrap file loading the React app entry script.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React component handling authentication gating, routing between pages, and profile setup flow.
frontend/src/components/AuthGate.tsx: Handles login/logout via Internet Identity and guards the app until authentication completes.
frontend/src/components/GameLayout.tsx: Defines the main game layout with navigation, header, logout handling, and dynamic admin menu entry.
frontend/src/components/ProfileSetupDial: Provides a dialog for creating a new player profile with a create button and loading state.
frontend/src/components/ProgressionPanel: Renders a survivor’s level, experience progress, and core stats using styled UI components.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor tied to the user’s identity and refreshes dependent queries when it changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Implements Internet Identity auth context with login, logout, and identity loading logic.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Contains React Query hooks for fetching and mutating player profiles, survivors, and related game data via the actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind CSS setup and theme variables for light and dark modes.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with QueryClient and Internet Identity providers.
frontend/src/pages/AdminPanelPage.tsx: Admin interface allowing admins to grant currency, unlock killers, set levels, add weapons or pets, and create admin events.
frontend/src/pages/ClansPage.tsx: Displays clan marketplace and join listings, with features to create listings, form clans, and join or randomly join clans.
frontend/src/pages/DungeonPage.tsx: Shows available dungeons, lets players start and complete quests, unlock crates, and view rewards.
frontend/src/pages/GameplayPage.tsx: Handles enemy combat flow, including starting fights, performing attacks, and managing combat state.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Home dashboard summarizing player status and linking to survivors, combat, inventory, killers, shop, and admin pages.
frontend/src/pages/InventoryPage.tsx: Displays the user's weapons and pets, allowing equipping items and showing stats, with loading and empty states.
frontend/src/pages/KillersPage.tsx: Shows the list of killers, their stats, and unlock status, and allows unlocking the next killer in sequence.
frontend/src/pages/ShopPage.tsx: Displays purchasable upgrades, notably the Admin Panel, showing cost, affordability, and purchase actions or alerts.
frontend/src/pages/SocialPage.tsx: Provides UI for following and unfollowing users via Principal IDs and displays followers, following, and friends lists.
frontend/src/pages/SurvivorsPage.tsx: Manages survivor characters, enabling creation with custom stats and selecting an active survivor.
frontend/src/pages/UpdatesPage.tsx: React page that displays a list of game update entries with titles, versions, dates, descriptions, and feature lists using UI card components.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for reading, storing, persisting, and clearing URL and session-based parameters, including hash-routing support.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining theme extensions, color variables, fonts, animations, and plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Project metadata describing game features, architecture notes, progression systems, social features, and existing requirement-linked feature implementations.
